com.locuslabs.sdk.maps.implementation

Class DefaultTheme

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.locuslabs.sdk.maps.implementation.DefaultTheme
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Theme

    public class DefaultTheme
extends java.lang.Object
implements Theme
    An implementation of Theme. What should be of particular interest to any future development is that the method signatures are factorized. Meaning the quantity of methods is based off the supported Types when multiplied with another produces a given number or expression.
    Since:
    1.2.5
    See Also:
    Theme, MapView

      Like textView(TextView, Theme, String) except gives the caller more control over the names of the individual properties.

    • Method Detail

      • textView

        public static void textView(TextView textView,
                            Theme theme,
                            java.lang.String themeString,
                            java.lang.String colorTextProp,
                            java.lang.String colorBackgroundProp,
                            java.lang.String fontSizeProp,
                            java.lang.String fontNameProp,
                            java.lang.String drawableColorProp)
        Like textView(TextView, Theme, String) except gives the caller more control over the names of the individual properties. If any are null, it computes a default based on themeString.
        Parameters:
        textView -
        theme -
        themeString -
        colorTextProp - if null computes a default based on themeString
        colorBackgroundProp - if null computes a default based on themeString
        fontSizeProp - if null computes a default based on themeString
        fontNameProp - if null computes a default based on themeString
        drawableColorProp - if null computes a default based on themeString

      • textView

        public static void textView(TextView textView,
                            Theme theme,
                            java.lang.String themeString)
        Sets all the relevant theme properties of a text view.

        A compound drawable relative is an icon drawn next to a TextView. Since Android recommends "start" instead of "left" for i18n, we tend to use the "relative" version of compound drawables. For example, the following is an icon drawn to the left of the poiLocation TextView:

        android:drawableStart="@drawable/poi_icon_location"

        see https://developer.android.com/reference/android/widget/TextView.html#getCompoundDrawablesRelative()

        Parameters:
        textView -
        theme -
        themeString -
